title: Calculator: Breakfast
question_text:
It has been determined that $45\%$ of U.S. citizens eat breakfast at least $5\text{ days}$ per week.
If $25\text{ subjects}$ are randomly chosen, what is the approximate probability that the number of individuals who eat breakfast at least $5\text{ days}$ per week is within $1$ standard deviation of the mean?
solution:
First find the mean: nP=25⋅0.45=11.25
.

Then find the standard deviation:
√
(25⋅0.45⋅0.55)
=2.487

Mean+1 standard deviation=11.25+2.487=8.763 to 13.737

Use this range to find the probability that x
equals 9,10,11,12,
and 13
.

P(x=9)=0.459⋅0.5516⋅25C9

P(x=10)=0.4510⋅0.5515⋅25C10

P(x=11)=0.4511⋅0.5514⋅25C11

P(x=12)=0.4512⋅0.5513⋅25C12

P(x=13)=0.4513⋅0.5512⋅25C13

Add these probabilities up to get
0.6833
, or
68.33
%
.
